data.description: Start building your future with WellSky!Join a culture of collaboration, innovation, and bold ideas that are transforming healthcare. As a Software Engineer Intern, you’ll dive into real-world projects—designing, developing, and testing software that makes a difference.Our program offers hands-on experience, cutting-edge technologies, and immediate impact. You’ll grow your skills, connect with a dynamic intern cohort, and network across the organization - all while working onsite at our world headquarters in Overland Park, KS.Ready to shape the future of care? We invite you to apply today!Responsibilities Can Include:Writing and debugging code for business applications in the healthcare domainResearching, investigating, and fixing a wide range of technical issues and proactively learning new technologies to support our software applicationsParticipating in documenting and preparing system requirements and design specifications and testing software applicationsCreatively approaching problems and proposing solutions in collaboration with WellSky teammates and senior leadersRequired Qualifications:Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related fieldFamiliarity and demonstrated competency with several key languages, technologies, and platforms used at WellSky, including (but not limited to): TypeScript/JavaScript, .NET, Ruby on Rails, C#, Python, SQL, Java, Angular, PowerShell, and GitHub CopilotPreferred Qualifications:On track to graduate within the next two years (junior or senior standing) Job Expectations:Willing to work additional or irregular hours as neededMust work in accordance with applicable security policies and procedures to safeguard company and client informationMust be able to sit and view a computer screen for extended periods of timeWellSky is where independent thinking and collaboration come together to create an authentic culture. We thrive on innovation, inclusiveness, and cohesive perspectives. At WellSky you can make a difference.WellSky provides equal employment opportunities to all people without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, religion, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, pregnancy, physical or mental disability, protected medical condition, genetic information, military service, veteran status, or any other status or characteristic protected by law. WellSky is proud to be a drug-free workplace. Applicants for U.S.-based positions with WellSky must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Certain client-facing positions may be required to comply with applicable requirements, such as immunizations and occupational health mandates.  Here are some of the exciting benefits full-time teammates are eligible to receive at WellSky:Excellent medical, dental, and vision benefitsMental health benefits through TelaDocPrescription drug coverageGenerous paid time off, plus 13 paid holidaysPaid parental leave100% vested 401(K) retirement plansEducational assistance up to $2500 per year
requirements: Participating in documenting and preparing system requirements and design specifications and testing software applications
Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field
On track to graduate within the next two years (junior or senior standing)
Educational assistance up to $2500 per year
responsibilities: Willing to work additional or irregular hours as needed
